answerText: thin layer chromatography [or TLC][10] After the sample has been applied to the TLC plate, it and the solvent will travel up the plate via this gravity-defying ability. It occurs in thin tubes as a consequence of surface tension and adhesion.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Editors Round 3 | 17 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Give some aspects of a common lab procedure used in organic chemistry, for ten points each. [10] The thin layer type of this procedure usually involves applying a drop of an unknown mixture on a piece of glass coated with silica and placing it into a container with a solvent in order to separate each colored component.
